website_summaries.verdict: Microsoft's SideWinder X8 isn't the only mouse that can swap seamlessly between wired and wireless modes; however, between its BlueTrack sensor and its on-the-fly macro recording capability--not to mention a competitive price--we imagine few PC gamers won't want to get their hands on it.
pros: Hybrid wired/wireless design eliminates downtime between battery charges
BlueTrack sensor expands mousing surface options
cons: Scroll wheel needs a better grip
signal drop-off in wireless mode at high sensitivity

customer_reviews.title: Happy, but....
customer_reviews.text: I am over all happy with this mouse. There is a few things I feel must be said about it. One, the side buttons are plastic not metal like on the older side winder. Two, it is really lite wieght. Three, there is no blue light in the rear of the mouse like in the pictures. It does work great with or with out the cord hooked up. I do wish it was a little longer as I have large hands. As far as the dpi 500, 1000, and 4000, I wish it also had a 2000 setting. I have used it a month now and am getting use to it size for the most part.
customer_reviews.author: Henry H.

customer_reviews.title: I love this mouse
customer_reviews.text: i've had 3 of these mice. they only warrantee it for 6 months for a reason. they break-down quickly, but I use my mouse a lot as a heavy gamer. the bindings for the extra buttons are quick and easy. the batteries seem to burn out right at 6 months, so i ordered a pack of the same thing that comes with this, from amazon. great mouse, I just wish it was a bit more durable. I will order another 1, as after you play a pc game with it, you will never want another mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Trinity

customer_reviews.title: Sidewinder X8
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great battery life, I am on my PC more than I care to think about and I am charging the battery about once a week. It only takes about an hour to charge fully and the fact that you don't have to stop using the mouse to charge is great. Using macros for functions in game works great. Being able to adjust the DPI on the fly is a feature I didn't really look forward to but I probably use it the most. Mainly when switching from regular tasks to games or using photoshop. I have had this mouse for about 3 months and it's just like the day I bought it, so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Light

customer_reviews.title: Could have been great... breaks too easily.
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep this short.I purchased in July, Awesome mouse overall with a few drawbacks. Wide; mouse can cause smaller hands to cramp up with extended use. Wheel; the clickity clickity when you roll the wheel is messed up, sometimes its fine others its smooth rolling then catch's, very weird. (update October 2011) I'm replacing this mouse with a Logitech G400. I'm sick of paying 50+ bucks for mice that dont work right for more than 6 months at a time. The wheel issue never got worse but now the left click is failing with nearly every other click not registering. Not the best thing for gaming as you could imagine.
customer_reviews.author: Heru

customer_reviews.title: Very Quality Gaming Mouse For The Price.
customer_reviews.text: Battery last a long time Price is cheap Mouse fits in my big hands The charging cord is easy to attach Accuracy in game only takes about a week to get use too. THE BAD The DPI is in a silly location The cord charger look cheesy The drivers do not install automatically for a Microsoft Product using Microsoft Windows????? Overall Very Nice Wireless Mouse for Gamers with big Hands.
customer_reviews.author: BMOSS

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse, but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse works flawlessly and tracks very well. The ability to change your DPI setting on the fly is useful, the limitation of having to pick from pre-defined DPI settings instead of being able to set your own is not. The scroll wheel could definitely use some more traction for your finger. Scrolling is harder than it needs to be, but it's not a major issue. I would buy this mouse again, because I think its the best mouse currently out there, but they could have made it so much better.
customer_reviews.author: T. Johansen

customer_reviews.title: <3 this mouse
customer_reviews.text: I got this mouse to replace my older microsoft x5. The x5 had a rubber scroll wheel that wore badly and made it tough to scroll. I liked the overall design and feel of it though so went with the x8. Scroll wheel issue is completely eliminated due to x8 having a hard wheel as opposed to soft rubber. Wireless works great, so long as I don't set my phone down next to the mouse. Play and charge works perfect. I've run into 0 problems with this mouse so far. Would def recommend this to anyone looking for a nice gaming mouse and doesn't like the Razer or Logitech mice.
customer_reviews.author: Vinsanity

customer_reviews.title: Nice, responsive and expensive.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty, but at first it felt made of cheap materials. Any way, the mouse works perfectly. My only complain would be the right button, because if I don't press it at the farthest front side, it feels stuck. It's helped me to improve my gaming. A lot better than a pad controller or regular mouse. I think it's expensive for what you get, really, eventhough I payed about $60 for it.
customer_reviews.author: Serpens Solida

customer_reviews.title: Charging cable failed on amazing mouse (3yrs)
customer_reviews.text: Owned mouse since 2010, only a few issues: minor wear and smoothing of most used surfaces, plastic covering status light fell off (I've dropped it a few times), and the biggest real issue is that three years into owning it, the charging cable no longer charges battery. Not sure if it's on the mouse end, cable, or attachment point. I use other batteries that I charge separately, and problem solved. Love this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: lacroixw

customer_reviews.title: well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Microsoft did it again, this is a great product, compared to G11 and the razer, this is cheaper and performs really good for a wireless mouse, i did a lot of research before buying this, i was going to buy the Mamba, but its was very expensive, overall great product, the software is glitchy though.
customer_reviews.author: SFOD

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this with the intention of replacing my all wireless Keyboard and Mouse set up I have had for years. Buying this with the Sidewinder X6 Keyboard I was very happy with the feel of the mouse. The ability to switch sensitivities quickly is an ability I have wanted in my mouse for a few years now. The fit for my hand is fine and tracking on the movement is amazing (Note: I do use a mouse pad underneath to not have the sore wrist from pressing on the wood the entire time. I recommend this for just about anyone, gamer to non-gamer with the interest of there is always a need for more buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick711

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse...horrid battery life
customer_reviews.text: The mouse does everything I wanted it to. I love the button layout and the way it feels in my hand. I have medium sized hands and I could see where this mouse wouldn't be ideal for someone for small hands. The battery life on the other hand is atrocious. Granted this may be the rechargeable that I am using(Energizer) but this mouse can kill a fully charged battery in a week at 4k DPI. I do a lot of gaming so this figures into it. I also have a Microsoft Arc Mouse and the battery last close to two months and I had been using it just as much before I got this mouse.

customer_reviews.title: Beats the pants out of Razer Mamba

The driver software is very simple and just does what it's needed to do (it also doesn't take forever to "read and save" to/from the mouse every time you open it. The charger cord is barely noticable when it's connected. Most important, it never misses a beat. You'll forget it's a wireless mouse when it's on 4000 dpi.

customer_reviews.title: Good as long it lasts
customer_reviews.text: This WAS a good mouse, solid build and very precise. However, after 5 months of use it started to show some erratic clicking and problems while recharging. USB connection begins to alternate between "plugged" and "unplugged" and the only way to solve it is to keep changing USB ports until it stops (this can drive you mad, believe me). This mouse had the potential to be a great product, but this problem alone is a deal breaker.

product_meta.title: Microsoft SideWinder X8 Mouse
product_meta.description:
Microsoft SideWinder X8 Mouse - 4000 dpi - Play and Charge - 13000 FPS - Wireless

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From the Manufacturer 

 Overview:

 The Ultimate Gaming Mouse System
Grab hold of the Microsoft® SideWinder™ X8 mouse and experience gaming thrills and performance that will blow you—and your opponents—away! This addition to Microsoft’s award-winning line of SideWinder gaming products is a complete desktop gaming system that features breakthrough Microsoft BlueTrack™ Technology, 2.4 GHz wireless, USB charging while you play, an advanced design for precise handling and fast action, adjustable feet, custom tuning—and much more.

 Features:


Play and Charge
Up to 30 hours of active gaming on a single charge, or use the play-and charge cable for non-stop action. BlueTrack™ Technology
World’s most advanced tracking technology for gaming with image processing of 13,000 frames per second, with improved tracking on carpet, granite, and even wood surfaces. Quick Launch Button
One-touch access to Microsoft PC gaming features. Vertical Side Buttons
Top/bottom design makes locating side buttons easier and reduces inadvertent actuation risk. Engineered for Speed
Shape designed for quick, balanced, precision gaming action. Scroll Wheel with Tilt
Better feel and response with detents for precise control. 

Additional Features: * 2.4 GHz Wireless - Built for lag-free play.
 * LCD Display - Quickly view DPI settings and macro-recording icons on the mouse.
 * DPI Switching - Instantly switch sensitivity between high, medium, and low with one click.
 * Replaceable Mouse Feet - Choice of 3 different materials for glide preference. 
 * 7 Programmable Buttons - Customize 5 programmable main buttons, plus left/right tilt, to your preference.
 * Macro Record - Easily record macros while in game with the dedicated button.

Specs:

 * Resolution: 250–4000 dpi (BlueTrack™ Technology)
 * Image Processing: 13000 frames per second
 * Max Acceleration: 75 G
 * Max Speed: 120 inches per second
 * USB Reporting: Full-speed, 500 Hz
 * Feet: 3 sets of different mouse feet (for glide preference)
 * Wireless Play: Up to 30 hours

System Requirements * Windows Vista®/Windows XP * 100 MB
   
   
 * USB Port
 * CD drive
